intro: Norantea goyasensis, commonly known as the Goyasense orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its intricate, showy flowers with vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, anchoring itself to tree trunks or branches in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in the humid environment. Norantea goyasensis plays a significant role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its region.
